member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RecoveryCallback
member.summary: The that represents the callback method invoked by the system when an application has registered for application recovery.
member.param: An application-defined state object that is passed to the callback method.
member.remarks: The callback method will be invoked prior to the application being terminated by Windows Error Reporting (WER). To keep WER from terminating the application before the callback method completes, the callback method must periodically call the method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData
member.summary: Defines a class that contains a callback delegate and properties of the application as defined by the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RecoveryCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a recovery data wrapper with a callback method and the current state of the application.
member.param: The callback delegate.
The current state of the application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData.Callback
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the recovery callback function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData.State
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the application state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RecoveryData.Invoke
member.summary: Invokes the recovery callback function.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions
member.summary: Specifies the conditions when Windows Error Reporting should not restart an application that has registered for automatic restart.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.None
member.summary: Always restart the application.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.NotOnCrash
member.summary: Do not restart when the application has crashed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.NotOnHang
member.summary: Do not restart when the application is hung.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.NotOnPatch
member.summary: Do not restart when the application is terminated due to a system update.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.RestartRestrictions.NotOnReboot
member.summary: Do not restart when the application is terminated because of a system reboot.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.ApplicationServices.PowerManagementNativeMethods.PowerGetActiveScheme(System.IntPtr,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Gets the Guid relating to the currently active power scheme.
member.param: Reserved for future use, this must be set to IntPtr.Zero
Returns a Guid referring to the currently active power scheme.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats
member.summary: The clipboard formats defined by the system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.Bitmap
member.summary: A handle to a bitmap (HBITMAP).

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.Dib
member.summary: A memory object containing a BITMAPINFO structure followed by the bitmap bits.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.DibV5
member.summary: A memory object containing a BITMAPV5HEADER structure followed by the bitmap color space information and the bitmap bits.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.Dif
member.summary: Software Arts' Data Interchange Format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.DSBitmap
member.summary: Bitmap display format associated with a private format. The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in bitmap format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.DSPEnhMetaFile
member.summary: Enhanced metafile display format associated with a private format. The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in enhanced metafile format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.DSPMetaFilePicture
member.summary: Metafile-picture display format associated with a private format. The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in metafile-picture format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.DSPText
member.summary: Text display format associated with a private format. The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in text format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.EnhMetaFile
member.summary: A handle to an enhanced metafile (HENHMETAFILE).

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.GDIObjFirst
member.summary: Start of a range of integer values for application-defined GDI object clipboard formats. The end of the range is . Handles associated with clipboard formats in this range are not automatically deleted using the GlobalFree function when the clipboard is emptied. Also, when using values in this range, the hMem parameter is not a handle to a GDI object, but is a handle allocated by the GlobalAlloc function with the GMEM_MOVEABLE flag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.GDIObjLast
member.summary: See .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.HDrop
member.summary: A handle to type HDROP that identifies a list of files. An application can retrieve information about the files by passing the handle to the DragQueryFile function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.Locale
member.summary: The data is a handle to the locale identifier associated with text in the clipboard. When you close the clipboard, if it contains data but no Locale data, the system automatically sets the Locale format to the current input language. You can use the Locale format to associate a different locale with the clipboard text. An application that pastes text from the clipboard can retrieve this format to determine which character set was used to generate the text. Note that the clipboard does not support plain text in multiple character sets. To achieve this, use a formatted text data type such as RTF instead. The system uses the code page associated with Locale to implicitly convert from to . Therefore, the correct code page table is used for the conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.MetaFilePicture
member.summary: Handle to a metafile picture format as defined by the MetaFilePicture structure. When passing a MetaFilePicture handle by means of DDE, the application responsible for deleting hMem should also free the metafile referred to by the MetaFilePicture handle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.OEMText
member.summary: Text format containing characters in the OEM character set. Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination. A null character signals the end of the data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.OwnerDisplay
member.summary: Owner-display format. The clipboard owner must display and update the clipboard viewer window, and receive the WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME, WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD, WM_PAINTCLIPBOARD, WM_SIZECLIPBOARD, and WM_VSCROLLCLIPBOARD messages. The hMem parameter must be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.Palette
member.summary: Handle to a color palette. Whenever an application places data in the clipboard that depends on or assumes a color palette, it should place the palette on the clipboard as well. If the clipboard contains data in the Palette (logical color palette) format, the application should use the SelectPalette and RealizePalette functions to realize (compare) any other data in the clipboard against that logical palette. When displaying clipboard data, the clipboard always uses as its current palette any object on the clipboard that is in the Palette format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.PenData
member.summary: Data for the pen extensions to the Microsoft Windows for Pen Computing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.PrivateFirst
member.summary: Start of a range of integer values for private clipboard formats.The range ends with . Handles associated with private clipboard formats are not freed automatically; the clipboard owner must free such handles, typically in response to the WM_DESTROYCLIPBOARD message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.PrivateLast
member.summary: See .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.RIFF
member.summary: Represents audio data more complex than can be represented in a standard wave format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.SYLK
member.summary: Microsoft Symbolic Link (SYLK) format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.Text
member.summary: Text format. Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination. A null character signals the end of the data.Use this format for ANSI text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.TIFF
member.summary: Tagged-image file format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.UnicodeText
member.summary: Unicode text format.Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination. A null character signals the end of the data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.StandardClipboardFormats.Wave
member.summary: Represents audio data in one of the standard wave formats, such as 11 kHz or 22 kHz PCM.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.CoreNativeMethods.PostMessage(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.WindowMessage,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Places (posts) a message in the message queue associated with the thread that created the specified window and returns without waiting for the thread to process the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
Specifies additional message-specific information.
Specifies additional message-specific information.
member.returns: A return code specific to the message being sent.

Enables away mode. This value must be specified with ES_CONTINUOUS. Away mode should be used only by media-recording and media-distribution applications that must perform critical background processing on desktop computers while the computer appears to be sleeping. See Remarks.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000: ES_AWAYMODE_REQUIRED is not supported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.COM.CAUUID
member.summary: Specifies a counted array of types used to receive an array of CLSIDs for the property pages that the object wants to display.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.COM.CAUUID.cElems
member.summary: The size of the array pointed to by .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.COM.CAUUID.pElems
member.summary: A pointer to an array of values, each of which specifies a CLSID of a particular property page. This array is allocated by the callee using and is freed by the caller using .

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.COM.ISpecifyPropertyPages
member.summary: Indicates that an object supports property pages. OLE property pages enable an object to display its properties in a tabbed dialog box known as a property sheet. An end user can then view and change the object's properties. An object can display its property pages independent of its client, or the client can manage the display of property pages from a number of contained objects in a single property sheet. Property pages also provide a means for notifying a client of changes in an object's properties.

remarks.para: A property page object manages a particular page within a property sheet. A property page implements at least IPropertyPage and can optionally implement IPropertyPage2 if selection of a specific property is supported.

An object specifies its support for property pages by implementing . Through this interface the caller can obtain a list of CLSIDs identifying the specific property pages that the object supports. If the object specifies a property page CLSID, the object must be able to receive property changes from the property page.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.COM.ISpecifyPropertyPages.GetPages(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.COM.CAUUID@)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of property pages that can be displayed in this object's property sheet.
member.remarks: A pointer to a caller-allocated structure that must be initialized and filled before returning. The pElems member in the structure is allocated by the callee with and freed by the caller with .

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values and , as well as the following values.

remarks.para: The structure is caller-allocated, but is not initialized by the caller. The method fills the cElements member in the structure. This method also allocates memory for the array pointed to by the pElems member using . Then, it fills the newly allocated array. After this method returns successfully, the structure contains a counted array of UUIDs, each UUID specifying a property page CLSID.
Notes to Callers: The caller must release the memory pointed to by the member of , using when it is no longer needed.
Notes to Implementers: is not allowed as a return value, because an object with no property pages should not expose the interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyTypeOptions.IsQueryable
member.summary: This property is included in the list of properties that can be queried.
member.remarks: A queryable property must also be viewable. This influences whether the property shows up in the query builder UI. This value is set by the isQueryable attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyTypeOptions.CanBePurged
member.summary: Used with an innate property (that is, a value calculated from other property values) to indicate that it can be deleted.
member.remarks: Windows Vista with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and later. This value is used by the Remove Properties user interface (UI) to determine whether to display a check box next to an property that allows that property to be selected for removal. Note that a property that is not innate can always be purged regardless of the presence or absence of this flag.

summary.para: Description: Hash to determine acquisition session.
Type: String -- VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.
Description: The amount of total space in bytes.
Description: Legacy code treats this as VT_LPSTR.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)
Type: String -- VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.

Description: The list of type of items, this item contains. For example, this item contains urls, attachments etc. This is represented as a vector array of GUIDs where each GUID represents certain type.
Type: Multivalue Guid -- VT_VECTOR | VT_CLSID (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_CLSID)
Description: The time of the last access to the item. The Indexing Service friendly name is 'access'.

Description: The time the file entered the system via acquisition. This is not the same as System.DateImported. Examples are when pictures are acquired from a camera, or when music is purchased online.
Description: The date and time the item was created. The Indexing Service friendly name is 'create'.
Description: The time the file is imported into a separate database. This is not the same as System.DateAcquired. (Eg, 2003:05:22 13:55:04)
Description: The date and time of the last write to the item. The Indexing Service friendly name is 'write'.
Description: The contents of a SHDESCRIPTIONID structure as a buffer of bytes.
Type: Buffer -- VT_VECTOR | VT_UI1 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_UI1)
Description: This is the WIN32_FIND_DATA dwFileAttributes for the file-based item.
Description: This is a user-friendly description of the file.

Description: This is the file extension of the file based item, including the leading period.
If System.FileName is VT_EMPTY, then this property should be too. Otherwise, it should be derived appropriately by the data source from System.FileName. If System.FileName does not have a file extension, this value should be VT_EMPTY.
To obtain the type of any item (including an item that is not a file), use System.ItemType.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt"".txt" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" ".doc" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" ".xls" "\\server\share\folder" VT_EMPTY "c:\foo\MyFolder" VT_EMPTY [desktop] VT_EMPTY

Description: This is the unique file ID, also known as the File Reference Number. For a given file, this is the same value as is found in the structure variable FILE_ID_BOTH_DIR_INFO.FileId, via GetFileInformationByHandleEx().

Description: This is the file name (including extension) of the file.
It is possible that the item might not exist on a filesystem (ie, it may not be opened using CreateFile). Nonetheless, if the item is represented as a file from the logical sense (and its name follows standard Win32 file-naming syntax), then the data source should emit this property.
If an item is not a file, then the value for this property is VT_EMPTY. See System.ItemNameDisplay.
This has the same value as System.ParsingName for items that are provided by the Shell's file folder.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt""hello.txt" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "goodnews.doc" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "numbers.xls" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "MyFolder" (email message) VT_EMPTY (song on portable device) "song.wma"
Description: This is the owner of the file, according to the file system.
Description: WIN32_FIND_DATAW in buffer of bytes.
Type: Buffer -- VT_VECTOR | VT_UI1 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_UI1)
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.FlagColor. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: Status of Flag. Values: (0=none 1=white 2=Red). cdoPR_FLAG_STATUS
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.FlagStatus. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: The amount of free space in bytes.

Description: This PKEY is used to specify search terms that should be applied as broadly as possible, across all valid properties for the data source(s) being searched. It should not be emitted from a data source.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.Importance. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: The text (with formatted property values) to show in the infotip.
Description: Identifies if this item is an attachment.
Description: Identifies the default save location for a library for non-owners of the library
Description: Identifies the default save location for a library for the owner of the library
Description: Identifies if the message was not completely received for some error condition.
Description: A bool value to know if a location is supported (locally indexable, or remotely indexed).
Description: A bool value to know if a shell folder is pinned to the navigation pane
Description: Has the item been read?
Description: Identifies if a location or a library is search only
Description: Provided by certain shell folders. Return TRUE if the folder is a valid Send To target.
Description: Is this item shared? This only checks for ACLs that are not inherited.

Description: This is the generic list of authors associated with an item.
For example, the artist name for a track is the item author.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)

Description: This is the main date for an item. The date of interest.
For example, for photos this maps to System.Photo.DateTaken.

Description: This is the user-friendly display name of the parent folder of an item.
If System.ItemFolderPathDisplay is VT_EMPTY, then this property should be too. Otherwise, it should be derived appropriately by the data source from System.ItemFolderPathDisplay.
If the folder is a file folder, the value will be localized if a localized name is available.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt""bar" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "mydir" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "share" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "foo" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "Inbox"

Description: This is the user-friendly display path of the parent folder of an item.
If System.ItemPathDisplay is VT_EMPTY, then this property should be too. Otherwise, it should be derived appropriately by the data source from System.ItemPathDisplay.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt""c:\foo\bar" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "\\server\share\mydir" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "\\server\share" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "c:\foo" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox"

Description: This is the user-friendly display path of the parent folder of an item. The format of the string should be tailored such that the folder name comes first, to optimize for a narrow viewing column.
If the folder is a file folder, the value includes localized names if they are present.
If System.ItemFolderPathDisplay is VT_EMPTY, then this property should be too. Otherwise, it should be derived appropriately by the data source from System.ItemFolderPathDisplay.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt""bar (c:\foo)" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "mydir (\\server\share)" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "share (\\server)" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "foo (c:\)" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "Inbox (/Mailbox Account)"

Description: This is the base-name of the System.ItemNameDisplay.
If the item is a file this property includes the extension in all cases, and will be localized if a localized name is available.
If the item is a message, then the value of this property does not include the forwarding or reply prefixes (see System.ItemNamePrefix).

Description: This is the display name in "most complete" form. This is the best effort unique representation of the name of an item that makes sense for end users to read. It is the concatentation of System.ItemNamePrefix and System.ItemName.
If the item is a file this property includes the extension in all cases, and will be localized if a localized name is available.
There are acceptable cases when System.FileName is not VT_EMPTY, yet the value of this property is completely different. Email messages are a key example. If the item is an email message, the item name is likely the subject. In that case, the value must be the concatenation of the System.ItemNamePrefix and System.ItemName. Since the value of System.ItemNamePrefix excludes any trailing whitespace, the concatenation must include a whitespace when generating System.ItemNameDisplay.
Note that this property is not guaranteed to be unique, but the idea is to promote the most likely candidate that can be unique and also makes sense for end users. For example, for documents, you might think about using System.Title as the System.ItemNameDisplay, but in practice the title of the documents may not be useful or unique enough to be of value as the sole System.ItemNameDisplay. Instead, providing the value of System.FileName as the value of System.ItemNameDisplay is a better candidate. In Windows Mail, the emails are stored in the file system as .eml files and the System.FileName for those files are not human-friendly as they contain GUIDs. In this example, promoting System.Subject as System.ItemNameDisplay makes more sense.
Compatibility notes:
Shell folder implementations on Vista: use PKEY_ItemNameDisplay for the name column when you want Explorer to call ISF::GetDisplayNameOf(SHGDN_NORMAL) to get the value of the name. Use another PKEY (like PKEY_ItemName) when you want Explorer to call either the folder's property store or ISF2::GetDetailsEx in order to get the value of the name.
Shell folder implementations on XP: the first column needs to be the name column, and Explorer will call ISF::GetDisplayNameOf to get the value of the name. The PKEY/SCID does not matter.
Example values:
File: "hello.txt" Message: "Re: Let's talk about Tom's argyle socks!" Device folder: "song.wma" Folder:"Documents"

Description: This is the prefix of an item, used for email messages. where the subject begins with "Re:" which is the prefix.
If the item is a file, then the value of this property is VT_EMPTY.
If the item is a message, then the value of this property is the forwarding or reply prefixes (including delimiting colon, but no whitespace), or VT_EMPTY if there is no prefix.
Example values:
System.ItemNamePrefixSystem.ItemName System.ItemNameDisplay ---------------------------------------- ---------------------- VT_EMPTY "Great day" "Great day" "Re:""Great day" "Re: Great day" "Fwd: " "Monthly budget" "Fwd: Monthly budget" VT_EMPTY "accounts.xls" "accounts.xls"

Description: This is the generic list of people associated with an item and who contributed to the item.
For example, this is the combination of people in the To list, Cc list and sender of an email message.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)

Description: This is the user-friendly display path to the item.
If the item is a file or folder this property includes the extension in all cases, and will be localized if a localized name is available.
For other items,this is the user-friendly equivalent, assuming the item exists in hierarchical storage.
Unlike System.ItemUrl, this property value does not include the URL scheme.
To parse an item path, use System.ItemUrl or System.ParsingPath. To reference shell namespace items using shell APIs, use System.ParsingPath.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt""c:\foo\bar\hello.txt" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "\\server\share\numbers.xls" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'"

Description: This is the user-friendly display path to the item. The format of the string should be tailored such that the name comes first, to optimize for a narrow viewing column.
If the item is a file, the value excludes the file extension, and includes localized names if they are present. If the item is a message, the value includes the System.ItemNamePrefix.
To parse an item path, use System.ItemUrl or System.ParsingPath.
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt""hello (c:\foo\bar)" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "goodnews (\\server\share\mydir)" "\\server\share\folder" "folder (\\server\share)" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "MyFolder (c:\foo)" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "Re: Hello! (/Mailbox Account/Inbox)"

Description: This is the canonical type of the item and is intended to be programmatically parsed.
If there is no canonical type, the value is VT_EMPTY.
If the item is a file (ie, System.FileName is not VT_EMPTY), the value is the same as System.FileExtension.
Use System.ItemTypeText when you want to display the type to end users in a view. (If the item is a file, passing the System.ItemType value to PSFormatForDisplay will result in the same value as System.ItemTypeText.)
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt"".txt" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" ".doc" "\\server\share\folder" "Directory" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "Directory" [desktop] "Folder" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "MAPI/IPM.Message"

Description: This is the user friendly type name of the item. This is not intended to be programmatically parsed.
If System.ItemType is VT_EMPTY, the value of this property is also VT_EMPTY.
If the item is a file, the value of this property is the same as if you passed the file's System.ItemType value to PSFormatForDisplay.
This property should not be confused with System.Kind, where System.Kind is a high-level user friendly kind name. For example, for a document, System.Kind = "Document" and System.Item.Type = ".doc" and System.Item.TypeText = "Microsoft Word Document"
Example values:
If the path is... The property value is... ----------------- ------------------------ "c:\foo\bar\hello.txt""Text File" "\\server\share\mydir\goodnews.doc" "Microsoft Word Document" "\\server\share\folder" "File Folder" "c:\foo\MyFolder" "File Folder" "/Mailbox Account/Inbox/'Re: Hello!'" "Outlook E-Mail Message"

Description: This always represents a well formed URL that points to the item.
To reference shell namespace items using shell APIs, use System.ParsingPath.
Example values:
Files:"file:///c:/foo/bar/hello.txt" "csc://{GUID}/..." Messages: "mapi://..."
Description: The keywords for the item. Also referred to as tags.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR) Legacy code may treat this as VT_LPSTR.

Description: System.Kind is used to map extensions to various .Search folders. Extensions are mapped to Kinds at HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\KindMap The list of kinds is not extensible.
Type: Multivalue String -- VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR)
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.Kind. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.
Description: The MIME type. Eg, for EML files: 'message/rfc822'.
Description: The CLSID of the name space extension for an item, the object that implements IShellFolder for this item
Description: SID of the user that owns the library.
Description: used to get the IBindCtx for an item for parsing
Type: Any -- VT_NULL Legacy code may treat this as VT_UNKNOWN.
Description: The shell namespace name of an item relative to a parent folder. This name may be passed to IShellFolder::ParseDisplayName() of the parent shell folder.

Description: This is the shell namespace path to the item. This path may be passed to SHParseDisplayName to parse the path to the correct shell folder.
If the item is a file, the value is identical to System.ItemPathDisplay.
If the item cannot be accessed through the shell namespace, this value is VT_EMPTY.
Description: The perceived type of a shell item, based upon its canonical type.
Description: The amount filled as a percentage, multiplied by 100 (ie, the valid range is 0 through 100).
Description: This is the user-friendly form of System.Priority. Not intended to be parsed programmatically.

summary.para: Description: Indicates the altitude based on the reference in PKEY_GPS_AltitudeRef. Calculated from PKEY_GPS_AltitudeNumerator and PKEY_GPS_AltitudeDenominator
Description: Indicates the reference for the altitude property. (eg: above sea level, below sea level, absolute value)
Description: Represents the name of the GPS area
Description: Date and time of the GPS record
Description: Indicates the bearing to the destination point. Calculated from PKEY_GPS_DestBearingNumerator and PKEY_GPS_DestBearingDenominator.
Description: Indicates the reference used for the giving the bearing to the destination point. (eg: true direction, magnetic direction)
Description: Indicates the distance to the destination point. Calculated from PKEY_GPS_DestDistanceNumerator and PKEY_GPS_DestDistanceDenominator.
Description: Indicates the unit used to express the distance to the destination. (eg: kilometers, miles, knots)

Description: Indicates the latitude of the destination point. This is an array of three values. Index 0 is the degrees, index 1 is the minutes, index 2 is the seconds. Each is calculated from the values in PKEY_GPS_DestLatitudeNumerator and PKEY_GPS_DestLatitudeDenominator.
Type: Multivalue Double -- VT_VECTOR | VT_R8 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_R8)
Type: Multivalue UInt32 -- VT_VECTOR | VT_UI4 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_UI4)

Type: Multivalue Double -- VT_VECTOR | VT_R8 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_R8)

Description: Indicates direction of the image when it was captured. Calculated from PKEY_GPS_ImgDirectionNumerator and PKEY_GPS_ImgDirectionDenominator.
Description: Indicates reference for giving the direction of the image when it was captured. (eg: true direction, magnetic direction)

Description: Indicates the latitude. This is an array of three values. Index 0 is the degrees, index 1 is the minutes, index 2 is the seconds. Each is calculated from the values in PKEY_GPS_LatitudeNumerator and PKEY_GPS_LatitudeDenominator.
Type: Multivalue Double -- VT_VECTOR | VT_R8 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_R8)

Description: Indicates whether latitude is north or south latitude

Type: Multivalue Double -- VT_VECTOR | VT_R8 (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_R8)

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.PropertySystem.SystemProperties.System.PropList
member.summary: PropList Properties

summary.para: Description: The list of properties to show in the file operation conflict resolution dialog. Properties with empty values will not be displayed. Register under the regvalue of "ConflictPrompt".
Description: The list of properties to show in the content view mode of an item in the context of browsing. Register the regvalue under the name of "ContentViewModeForBrowse".
Description: The list of properties to show in the content view mode of an item in the context of searching. Register the regvalue under the name of "ContentViewModeForSearch".
Description: The list of properties to show in the listview on extended tiles. Register under the regvalue of "ExtendedTileInfo".

Description: The list of properties to show in the file operation confirmation dialog. Properties with empty values will not be displayed. If this list is not specified, then the InfoTip property list is used instead. Register under the regvalue of "FileOperationPrompt".

Description: The list of all the properties to show in the details page. Property groups can be included in this list in order to more easily organize the UI. Register under the regvalue of "FullDetails".
Description: The list of properties to show in the infotip. Properties with empty values will not be displayed. Register under the regvalue of "InfoTip".

Description: The list of properties that are considered 'non-personal'. When told to remove all non-personal properties from a given file, the system will leave these particular properties untouched. Register under the regvalue of "NonPersonal".
Description: The list of properties to display in the preview pane. Register under the regvalue of "PreviewDetails".
Description: The one or two properties to display in the preview pane title section. The optional second property is displayed as a subtitle. Register under the regvalue of "PreviewTitle".
Description: The list of properties to show in the infotip when the item is on a slow network. Properties with empty values will not be displayed. Register under the regvalue of "QuickTip".
Description: The list of properties to show in the listview on tiles. Register under the regvalue of "TileInfo".
Description: The list of properties to display in the XP webview details panel. Obsolete.

Description: The entry ID for an item within a given catalog in the Windows Search Index. This value may be recycled, and therefore is not considered unique over time.
Description: The Datetime that the Windows Search Gatherer process last pushed properties of this document to the Windows Search Gatherer Plugins.

Description: When using CONTAINS over the Windows Search Index, this is the number of matches of the term. If there are multiple CONTAINS, an AND computes the min number of hits and an OR the max number of hits.

Description: If this property is emitted with a value of TRUE, then it indicates that this URL's last modified time applies to all of it's children, and if this URL is deleted then all of it's children are deleted as well. For example, this would be emitted as TRUE when emitting the URL of an email so that all attachments are tied to the last modified time of that email.

Description: Any child URL of a URL which has System.Search.IsClosedDirectory=TRUE must emit System.Search.IsFullyContained=TRUE. This ensures that the URL is not deleted at the end of a crawl because it hasn't been visited (which is the normal mechanism for detecting deletes). For example an email attachment would emit this property
Description: Query Focused Summary of the document.
Description: Query Focused Summary of the document, if none is available it returns the AutoSummary.
Description: Relevance rank of row. Ranges from 0-1000. Larger numbers = better matches. Query-time only.
Description: The identifier for the protocol handler that produced this item. (E.g. MAPI, CSC, FILE etc.)
Description: This property should be emitted by a container IFilter for each child URL within the container. The children will eventually be crawled by the indexer if they are within scope.

Description: This property is the same as System.Search.UrlToIndex except that it includes the time the URL was last modified. This is an optimization for the indexer as it doesn't have to call back into the protocol handler to ask for this information to determine if the content needs to be indexed again. The property is a vector with two elements, a VT_LPWSTR with the URL and a VT_FILETIME for the last modified time.
Type: Multivalue Any -- VT_VECTOR | VT_NULL (For variants: VT_ARRAY | VT_NULL)

summary.para: Description: Set this to a string value of 'True' to omit this item from shell views

Description: Indicates the 4CC for the video stream.
Description: Indicates the frame height for the video stream.
Description: Indicates the frame rate in "frames per millisecond" for the video stream. "FrameRate".
Description: Indicates the frame width for the video stream.
Description: Indicates the horizontal portion of the aspect ratio. The X portion of XX:YY, like 16:9.
Description: Indicates the sample size in bits for the video stream. "SampleSize".
Description: Indicates the name for the video stream. "StreamName".
Description: Indicates the total data rate in "bits per second" for all video and audio streams.
Description: Indicates the vertical portion of the aspect ratio. The Y portion of XX:YY, like 16:9.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.CopyFileFlags
member.summary: Flags that specify how the file is to be copied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.CopyFileFlags.FailIfExists
member.summary: The copy operation fails immediately if the target file already exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.CopyFileFlags.Restartable
member.summary: Progress of the copy is tracked in the target file in case the copy fails. The failed copy can be restarted at a later time by specifying the same values for lpExistingFileName and lpNewFileName as those used in the call that failed. This can significantly slow down the copy operation as the new file may be flushed multiple times during the copy operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.CopyFileFlags.OpenSourceForWrite
member.summary: The file is copied and the original file is opened for write access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.CopyFileFlags.AllowDecryptedDestination
member.summary: An attempt to copy an encrypted file will succeed even if the destination copy cannot be encrypted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.CopyFileFlags.CopySymLink
member.summary:
If the source file is a symbolic link, the destination file is also a symbolic link pointing to the same file that the source symbolic link is pointing to.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.CopyFileFlags.NoBuffering
member.summary:
The copy operation is performed using unbuffered I/O, bypassing system I/O cache resources. Recommended for very large file transfers.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.CopyProgressCallbackReason.StreamSwitch

When this method returns, this parameter points to a returned token that uniquely identifies this connection. The calling application uses this token later to delete the connection by passing it to . If the call to fails, this value is meaningless.

member.summary: Exposes methods to get, set, and query a progress dialog.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.IOperationsProgressDialog.StartProgressDialog(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG)
member.summary: Starts the specified progress dialog.
member.param: A handle to the parent window.
Flags that customize the operation. Note that these flags are declared in Shlobj.h.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns . Otherwise, it returns an error code.

remarks.para: The progress dialog should be created on a separate thread than the file operation on which the dialog is reporting. If the dialog is running in the same thread as the file operation, progress messages are, at best, only sent as resources allow. Progress messages on the same thread as the file operation might not be sent at all.

Once is called, that instance of the CLSID_ProgressDialog object cannot be accessed by IProgressDialog, IActionProgressDialog, or IActionProgress. Although QueryInterface can be used to access these interfaces, most of their methods cannot be invoked. IOperationsProgressDialog is the interface used to display the new progress dialog for the Windows Vista and later operations engine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.IFileOperationProgressSink.UpdateProgress(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Provides an estimate of the total amount of work currently done in relation to the total amount of work.
member.param: An estimate of the amount of work to be completed.
The portion of iWorkTotal that has been completed so far.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns . Otherwise, it returns an error code.
member.remarks: The iWorkTotal and iWorkSoFar values are "points" or estimates of the amount of work to be done, and how much is completed. They are not specified in any particular units, but should be roughly proportional to how much time the total process takes. For example, to copy one small file might be considered two points, and a large file might be considered ten points. If a process is performing an operation that copies five small files and one large file, and the process has completed four of the small files, iWorkSoFar would be eight points (4 x 2 = 8) and iWorkTotal would be twenty points (5 x 2 + 10 = 20), so the estimate would be 8 of 20 points (or 40%) complete.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SearchConditionOperation.ValueEndsWith

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SearchConditionOperation.ValueContains

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SearchConditionOperation.ValueNotContains
member.summary: The value of the property must not contain the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SearchConditionOperation.DosWildcards
member.summary: The value of the property must match the value of the constant, where '?' matches any single character and '*' matches any sequence of characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SearchConditionOperation.WordEqual
member.summary: The value of the property must contain a word that is the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SearchConditionOperation.WordStartsWith
member.summary: The value of the property must contain a word that begins with the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SearchConditionOperation.ApplicationSpecific
member.summary: The application is free to interpret this in any suitable way.

member.summary: Indicates that the node is a comparison between a property and a constant value using a .

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SortDirection
member.summary: The direction in which the items are sorted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SortDirection.Default
member.summary: A default value for sort direction, this value should not be used; instead use Descending or Ascending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SortDirection.Descending
member.summary: The items are sorted in descending order. Whether the sort is alphabetical, numerical, and so on, is determined by the data type of the column indicated in propkey.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.SortDirection.Ascending
member.summary: The items are sorted in ascending order. Whether the sort is alphabetical, numerical, and so on, is determined by the data type of the column indicated in propkey.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetOption and IQueryParser::GetOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Schema
member.summary: The value should be VT_LPWSTR and the path to a file containing a schema binary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Locale
member.summary: The value must be VT_EMPTY (the default) or a VT_UI4 that is an LCID. It is used as the locale of contents (not keywords) in the query to be searched for, when no other information is available. The default value is the current keyboard locale. Retrieving the value always returns a VT_UI4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.WordBreaker
member.summary: This option is used to override the default word breaker used when identifying keywords in queries. The default word breaker is chosen according to the language of the keywords (cf. SQSO_LANGUAGE_KEYWORDS below). When setting this option, the value should be VT_EMPTY for using the default word breaker, or a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.NaturalSyntax
member.summary: The value should be VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to allow natural query syntax (the default) or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to allow only advanced query syntax. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL. This option is now deprecated, use SQSO_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.AutomaticWildcard
member.summary: The value should be VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to generate query expressions as if each word in the query had a star appended to it (unless followed by punctuation other than a parenthesis), or VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to use the words as they are (the default). A word-wheeling application will generally want to set this option to true. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TraceLevel
member.summary: Reserved. The value should be VT_EMPTY (the default) or VT_I4. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_I4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.LanguageKeywords
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a LANGID. It defaults to the default user UI language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Syntax
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a STRUCTURED_QUERY_SYNTAX value. It defaults to SQS_NATURAL_QUERY_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TimeZone
member.summary: The value must be a VT_BLOB that is a copy of a TIME_ZONE_INFORMATION structure. It defaults to the current time zone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ImplicitConnector
member.summary: This setting decides what connector should be assumed between conditions when none is specified. The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CONDITION_TYPE. Only CT_AND_CONDITION and CT_OR_CONDITION are valid. It defaults to CT_AND_CONDITION.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ConnectorCase
member.summary: This setting decides whether there are special requirements on the case of connector keywords (such as AND or OR). The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CASE_REQUIREMENT value. It defaults to CASE_REQUIREMENT_UPPER_IF_AQS.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetMultiOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.VirtualProperty
member.summary: The key should be property name P. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with an IEnumVARIANT which has two values: a VT_BSTR that is another property name Q and a VT_I4 that is a CONDITION_OPERATION cop. A predicate with property name P, some operation and a value V will then be replaced by a predicate with property name Q, operation cop and value V before further processing happens.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.DefaultProperty
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_LPWSTR with a property name P. A predicate with no property name and a value of type V (or any subtype of V) will then use property P.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.GeneratorForType
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with a IConditionGenerator G. The GenerateForLeaf method of G will then be applied to any predicate with value type V and if it returns a query expression, that will be used. If it returns NULL, normal processing will be used instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.MapProperty
member.summary: The key should be a property name P. The value should be a VT_VECTOR|VT_LPWSTR, where each string is a property name. The count must be at least one. This "map" will be added to those of the loaded schema and used during resolution. A second call with the same key will replace the current map. If the value is VT_NULL, the map will be removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption
member.summary: Used by IQueryParserManager::SetOption to set parsing options. This can be used to specify schemas and localization options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.SchemaBinaryName
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the name of the file that contains the schema binary. The default value is StructuredQuerySchema.bin for the SystemIndex catalog and StructuredQuerySchemaTrivial.bin for the trivial catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.PreLocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: Either a VT_BOOL or a VT_LPWSTR. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is FALSE, a pre-localized schema will not be used. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is TRUE, IQueryParserManager will use the pre-localized schema binary in "%ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Microsoft\Windows". If the value is a VT_LPWSTR, the value should contain the full path of the folder in which the pre-localized schema binary can be found. The default value is VT_BOOL with TRUE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.UnlocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the unlocalized schema binary. The default value is "%SYSTEMROOT%\System32".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the localized schema binary that can be read and written to as needed. The default value is "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.AppendLCIDToLocalizedPath
member.summary: A VT_BOOL. If TRUE, then the paths for pre-localized and localized binaries have "\(LCID)" appended to them, where language code identifier (LCID) is the decimal locale ID for the localized language. The default is TRUE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizerSupport
member.summary: A VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting ISchemaLocalizerSupport. This object will be used instead of the default localizer support object.

summary.para: Prior to Windows Vista, operations could be undone only from the same process that performed the original operation.

In Windows Vista and later systems, the scope of the undo is a user session. Any process running in the user session can undo another operation. The undo state is held in the Explorer.exe process, and as long as that process is running, it can coordinate the undo functions.
If the source file parameter does not contain fully qualified path and file names, this flag is ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.FilesOnly
member.summary: Perform the operation only on files (not on folders) if a wildcard file name (.) is specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoConfirmation
member.summary: Respond with Yes to All for any dialog box that is displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoConfirmMkDir
member.summary: Do not confirm the creation of a new folder if the operation requires one to be created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoConnectedElements
member.summary: Do not move connected items as a group. Only move the specified files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoCopySecurityAttribs
member.summary: Do not copy the security attributes of the item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoErrorUI
member.summary: Do not display a message to the user if an error occurs. If this flag is set without , any error is treated as if the user had chosen Ignore or Continue in a dialog box. It halts the current action, sets a flag to indicate that an action was aborted, and proceeds with the rest of the operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoRecursion
member.summary: Only operate in the local folder. Do not operate recursively into subdirectories.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.RenameOnCollision
member.summary: Give the item being operated on a new name in a move, copy, or rename operation if an item with the target name already exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.Silent
member.summary: Do not display a progress dialog box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.WantNukeWarning
member.summary: Send a warning if a file or folder is being destroyed during a delete operation rather than recycled. This flag partially overrides .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.AddUndoRecord
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. The file operation was user-invoked and should be placed on the undo stack. This flag is preferred to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoSkipJunctions
member.summary: Walk into Shell namespace junctions. By default, junctions are not entered. For more information on junctions, see Specifying a Namespace Extension's Location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.PreferHardLink
member.summary: If possible, create a hard link rather than a new instance of the file in the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.ShowElevationPrompt
member.summary: If an operation requires elevated rights and the flag is set to disable error UI, display a UAC UI prompt nonetheless.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.EarlyFailure
member.summary: If is set together with , the entire set of operations is stopped upon encountering any error in any operation. This flag is valid only when is set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.PreserveFileExtensions
member.summary: Rename collisions in such a way as to preserve file name extensions. This flag is valid only when is also set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.KeepNewerFile
member.summary: Keep the newer file or folder, based on the Date Modified property, if a collision occurs. This is done automatically with no prompt UI presented to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoCopyHooks
member.summary: Do not use copy hooks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.NoMinimizeBox
member.summary: Do not allow the progress dialog to be minimized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.MoveACLSAcrossVolumes
member.summary: Copy the security attributes of the source item to the destination item when performing a cross-volume move operation. Without this flag, the destination item receives the security attributes of its new folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.DoNotDisplaySourcePath
member.summary: Do not display the path of the source item in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.DoNotDisplayDestPath
member.summary: Do not display the path of the destination item in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.RecycleOnDelete
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. When a file is deleted, send it to the Recycle Bin rather than permanently deleting it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.RequireElevation
member.summary: Introduced in Windows Vista SP1. The user expects a requirement for rights elevation, so do not display a dialog box asking for a confirmation of the elevation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.CopyAsDownload
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. Display a Downloading instead of Copying message in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.ShellOperationFlags.DoNotDisplayLocations
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. Do not display the location line in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.EmptyRecycleBinFlags.NoConfirmation
member.summary: No dialog box confirming the deletion of the objects will be displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.EmptyRecycleBinFlags.NoProgressUI
member.summary: No dialog box indicating the progress will be displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.EmptyRecycleBinFlags.NoSound
member.summary: No sound will be played when the operation is complete.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.PDMODE.Run
member.summary: The operation is running.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.PDMODE.Prelight

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.PDMODE.Undoing

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.PDMODE.ErrorsBlocking

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.Normal
member.summary: Default, normal progress dialog behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.Modal
member.summary: The dialog is modal to its hwndOwner. The default setting is modeless.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.AutoTime
member.summary: Update "Line3" text with the time remaining. This flag does not need to be implicitly set because progress dialogs started by automatically display the time remaining.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.NoTime
member.summary: Do not show the time remaining. We do not recommend setting this flag through because it goes against the purpose of the dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.NoMinimize
member.summary: Do not display the minimize button.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.NoProgressBar
member.summary: Do not display the progress bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.MarqueeProgress
member.summary: This flag is invalid in this method. To set the progress bar to marquee mode, use the flags in .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.NoCancel
member.summary: Do not display a cancel button because the operation cannot be canceled. Use this value only when absolutely necessary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.Default
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Indicates default, normal operation progress dialog behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.EnablePause
member.summary: Display a pause button. Use this only in situations where the operation can be paused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.AllowUndo
member.summary: The operation can be undone through the dialog. The Stop button becomes Undo. If pressed, the Undo button then reverts to Stop.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.DoNotDisplaySourcePath
member.summary: Do not display the path of source file in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.DoNotDisplayDestPath
member.summary: Do not display the path of the destination file in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.NoMultiDayEstimates

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.Shell.OPPROGDLG.DoNotDisplayLocations
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Do not display the location line in the progress dialog.
