member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceCapabilities
member.summary: The interface a variety of device capabilities, including supported formats, commands, and functional objects. You can retrieve this interface from a device by calling .

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceCapabilities.GetSupportedCommands(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceKeyCollection@)
member.summary: The method retrieves a list of all the supported commands for this device.
member.param: Reference to an interface that holds all the valid commands. For a list of commands that are defined by Windows Portable Devices, see Commands. The caller must release this interface when it is done with it.

returns.para: The method returns an . Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceCapabilities.GetCommandOptions(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PropertySystem.PropertyKey@,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceValues@)
member.summary: The method retrieves all the supported options for the specified command on the device.
member.param: A that specifies a command to query for supported options. For a list of the commands that are defined by Windows Portable Devices, see Commands.

Address of a variable that receives a pointer to an interface that contains the supported options. If no options are supported, this will not contain any values. The caller must release this interface when it is done with it. For more information, see Remarks.

returns.para: The method returns an HResult. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following list.

remarks.para: This method is called by applications that want to call a command directly on the driver by calling . Some commands allow the caller to specify additional options. For example, some drivers support recursive child deletion when deleting an object using the WPD_COMMAND_OBJECT_MANAGEMENT_DELETE_OBJECTS command.

If an option is a simple value, the key of the retrieved interface will be the name of the option, and the value will be a value of or . If an option has several values, the retrieved value will be a collection type that holds the supported values.

If this method is called for the WPD_COMMAND_STORAGE_FORMAT command and the ppOptions parameter is set to WPD_OPTION_VALID_OBJECT_IDS, the driver will return an IPortableDevicePropVariant collection of type that specifies the identifiers for each object on the device that can be formatted. (If this option does not exist, the format command is available for all objects.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceCapabilities.GetFunctionalCategories(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDevicePropVariantCollection@)
member.summary: The method retrieves all functional categories supported by the device.
member.param: Reference to an interface that holds all the functional categories for this device. The values will be s of type VT_CLSID in the retrieved values. The caller must release this interface when it is done with it.

returns.para: The method returns an HResult. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following list.

remarks.para: Functional categories describe the types of functions that a device can perform, such as image capture, audio capture, and storage. This method is typically very fast, because the driver usually queries the device only on startup and caches the results.
For an example of how to use this method see Retrieving the Functional Categories Supported by a Device.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceCapabilities.GetFunctionalObjects(System.Guid@,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDevicePropVariantCollection@)
member.summary: The method retrieves all functional objects that match a specified category on the device.
member.param: A reference to a that specifies the category to search for. This can be WPD_FUNCTIONAL_CATEGORY_ALL to return all functional objects.

A reference to an interface that contains the object IDs of the functional objects as strings (type in the retrieved items). If no objects of the requested type are found, this will be an empty collection (not ). The caller must release this interface when it is done with it.

returns.para: The method returns an HResult. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following list.

remarks.para: This operation is usually fast, because the driver does not need to perform a full content enumeration, and the number of retrieved functional objects is typically less than 10. If no objects of the requested type are found, this method will not return an error, but returns an empty collection for .
For an example of how to use this method, see Retrieving the Functional Object Identifiers for a Device

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceCapabilities.GetSupportedContentTypes(System.Guid@,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDevicePropVariantCollection@)
member.summary: The method retrieves all supported content types for a specified functional object type on a device.
member.param: A reference to a that specifies a functional object category. To get a list of functional categories on the device, call .

Reference to an interface that lists all the supported object types for the specified functional object category. These object types will be values of type VT_CLSID in the retrieved items. See Requirements for Objects for a list of object types defined by Windows Portable Devices. The caller must release this interface when it is done with it.

returns.para: The method returns an HResult. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceCapabilities.GetFixedPropertyAttributes(System.Guid@,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PropertySystem.PropertyKey@,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceValues@)
member.summary: The method retrieves the standard property attributes for a specified property and format. Standard attributes are those that have the same value for all objects of the same format. For example, one device might not allow users to modify video file names; this device would return WPD_PROPERTY_ATTRIBUTE_CAN_WRITE with a value of False for WMV formatted objects. Attributes that can have different values for a format, or optional attributes, are not returned.
member.param: A reference to a that specifies the format of the objects of interest. For format values, see Object Formats.
A reference to a that specifies the property that you want to know the attributes of. Properties defined by Windows Portable Devices are listed in Properties and Attributes.
Reference to an interface that holds the attributes and their values. The caller must release this interface when it is done with it.

returns.para: The method returns an HResult. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following list.

remarks.para: You can specify WPD_OBJECT_FORMAT_ALL for the Format parameter to retrieve the complete set of property attributes.
Attributes describe properties. Example attributes are WPD_PROPERTY_ATTRIBUTE_CAN_READ and WPD_PROPERTY_ATTRIBUTE_CAN_WRITE. This method does not retrieve resource attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.IPortableDeviceCapabilities.Cancel
member.summary: The method cancels a pending request on this interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HResult. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following list.

member.remarks: This method cancels all pending operations on the current device handle, which corresponds to a session associated with an interface. The Windows Portable Devices (WPD) API does not support targeted cancellation of specific operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.CaptureModes
member.summary: This enum describes the capture timing mode of a still image capture.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used by the WPD_STILL_IMAGE_CAPTURE_MODE property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.CaptureModes.CaptureModeUndefined
member.summary: The capture mode has not been defined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.CaptureModes.CaptureModeNormal
member.summary: No delay or burst mode should be used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.CaptureModes.CaptureModeBurst
member.summary: Specifies that a defined number of images should be captured with a defined interval between them. The number of images to capture and time delay between them are specified by the WPD_STILL_IMAGE_BURST_NUMBER and WPD_STILL_IMAGE_BURST_INTERVAL properties.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.CaptureModes.CaptureModeTimelapse
member.summary: Image capture should use time lapse photography. The number of images and interval between them are described by the WPD_STILL_IMAGE_BURST_NUMBER and WPD_STILL_IMAGE_BURST_INTERVAL properties.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureMeteringModes
member.summary: This enum describes the metering mode to use when estimating exposure for still image capture by a device.
member.remarks: Indicates the metering mode of the device. This enumeration is used by the WPD_STILL_IMAGE_EXPOSURE_METERING_MODE property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureMeteringModes.Undefined
member.summary: The metering mode is undefined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureMeteringModes.Average
member.summary: Use averaged exposure across the full image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureMeteringModes.CenterWeightedAverage
member.summary: Use an averaged exposure, with the center of the image given more weight.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureMeteringModes.MultiSpot
member.summary: Use a multi-spot averaging technique.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureMeteringModes.CenterSpot
member.summary: Use a center-spot averaging technique.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes
member.summary: This enum describes an exposure mode to use when capturing images with a device.
member.remarks: Indicates the exposure program mode of the device. This enumeration is used by the WPD_STILL_IMAGE_EXPOSURE_PROGRAM_MODE property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes.Undefined
member.summary: The exposure mode has not been specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes.Manual
member.summary: The application should specify all exposure settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes.Auto
member.summary: Use a device-defined automatic exposure mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes.AperturePriority
member.summary: An automated exposure mode that indicates that the lens aperture value should remain fixed, but shutter speed should be determined by the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes.ShutterPriority
member.summary: An automated exposure mode that indicates that the shutter speed should remain fixed, but that lens aperture should be determined by the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes.Creative
member.summary: An automated exposure mode that tries to maximize the depth of field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes.Action
member.summary: An automated exposure mode that tries to maximize the shutter speed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.ExposureProgramModes.Portrait
member.summary: An automated exposure mode that specifies a relatively shallow depth of field.

member.summary: Specifies that the flash should be synchronized with other external flash devices.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes
member.summary: This enum describes how the fields in a video file are encoded.

remarks.para: This enumeration is used by the WPD_VIDEO_SCAN_TYPE property.

There are two types of interleaved file formats that are specified by this enumeration. WPD_VIDEO_SCAN_TYPE_FIELD_INTERLEAVED refers to a file format where frames are delivered as they were scanned fields alternate and data goes line by line, as shown here: WPD_VIDEO_SCAN_TYPES enumeration

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes.Unused
member.summary: The scan type has not been defined for this video file, or is not applicable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes.Progressive
member.summary: A progressive scan video file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes.FieldInterleavedUpperFirst
member.summary: An interleaved video file where the fields alternate and the upper field (with line 1) is drawn first. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes.FieldInterleavedLowerFirst
member.summary: An interleaved video file where the fields alternate and the lower field (with line 2) is drawn first. For more information, see Remarks, following this section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes.FieldSingleUpperFirst
member.summary: An interleaved video file where the fields are sent as contiguous samples and the upper field (with line 1) is drawn first. For more information, see Remarks, following this section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes.FieldSingleLowerFirst
member.summary: An interleaved video file where the fields are sent as contiguous samples and the lower field (with line 2) is sent first.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes.MixedInterlace
member.summary: A video file with a mix of interlacing modes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.VideoScanTypes.MixedInterlaceAndProgressive
member.summary: A video file with a mix of interlaced and progressive modes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.WhiteBalanceSettings
member.summary: This enum describes how a video or image device weights color channels to achieve a proper white balance.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used by the WPD_STILL_IMAGE_WHITE_BALANCE property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.WhiteBalanceSettings.Undefined
member.summary: This value has not been defined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.WhiteBalanceSettings.Manual
member.summary: The white balance is set explicitly by using the WPD_STILL_IMAGE_RGB_GAIN property and will not change by itself.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.WhiteBalanceSettings.Automatic
member.summary: The device will set the white balance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.WhiteBalanceSettings.OnePushAutomatic
member.summary: The device will set the white balance, but only when the user pushes the device's capture button while aiming the device at a white field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.WhiteBalanceSettings.DayLight
member.summary: The device will use white balance numbers appropriate for use in most daylight settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.WhiteBalanceSettings.Tungsten
member.summary: The device will use white balance numbers appropriate for use in most indoor, incandescent lighting settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.WhiteBalanceSettings.Flash
member.summary: The device will use white balance numbers appropriate for use with a flash.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.DeviceTypes
member.summary: This enum describes the different Windows Portable Device (WPD) types commonly used to determine the basic classification and visual appearance of a portable device.

remarks.para: are read using the interface. WPD applications may use these values to determine the generic visual appearance of the device. That is, a camera picture is displayed for camera-like devices, a mobile phone picture is displayed for phone-like devices, and so on.
Note: WPD applications must use the capabilities of the portable device to determine functionally, not the value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.DeviceTypes.Generic
member.summary: A generic WPD that includes multifunction devices that do not fall into one of the other enumeration values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.DeviceTypes.Camera
member.summary: A camera device, such as a digital still camera.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.DeviceTypes.MediaPlayer
member.summary: A media player device that supports playing audio, video, or viewing pictures, such as a portable music player or portable media center. Not all of this functionally is classified as a WPD_DEVICE_TYPE_MEDIA_PLAYER. For example, portable music player devices are classified as WPD_DEVICE_TYPE_MEDIA_PLAYER.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.DeviceTypes.Phone
member.summary: A phone device, such as a mobile phone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.DeviceTypes.Video
member.summary: A video device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Win32Native.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.DeviceTypes.PersonalInformationManager
member.summary: A personal information manager device.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.Properties.Object
member.summary: This class defines all Commands-Parameters and Options associated with: and . This category is for all common object properties.

summary.para: Description: The abstract type for the object content-indicating the kinds of properties and data that may be supported on the object.
Description: of type VT_LPWSTR indicating a list of ObjectIDs.

Description: Indicates the Object ID of the closest functional object ancestor. For example-objects that represent files/folders under a Storage functional object-will have this property set to the object ID of the storage functional object.
Description: Indicates whether the thumbnail for this object should be generated from the default resource.
Description: If this object appears as a hint location-this property indicates the hint-specific name to display instead of the object name.
Description: Indicates the units supported on this object.
Description: Indicates the object's functional category.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.Properties.Storage
member.summary: This class defines all Commands-Parameters and Options associated with: . This category is for properties common to all objects whose functional category is .

summary.para: Description: Indicates the type of storage e.g. fixed-removable etc.
Description: Indicates the file system type e.g. "FAT32" or "NTFS" or "My Special File System"
Description: Indicates the total storage capacity in bytes.
Description: Indicates the available space in bytes.
Description: Indicates the available space in objects e.g. available slots on a SIM card.
Description: Contains a description of the storage.
Description: Contains the serial number of the storage.
Description: Specifies the maximum size of a single object (in bytes) that can be placed on this storage.
Description: Indicates the total storage capacity in objects e.g. available slots on a SIM card.
Description: This property identifies any write-protection that globally affects this storage. This takes precedence over access specified on individual objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.Properties.StillImageCapture
member.summary: This class defines all Commands-Parameters and Options associated with: . This category is for properties common to all objects whose functional category is WPD_FUNCTIONAL_CATEGORY_STILL_IMAGE_CAPTURE

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.Properties.AudioRendering
member.summary: This class defines all Commands-Parameters and Options associated with: . This category is for properties common to all objects whose functional category is WPD_FUNCTIONAL_CATEGORY_AUDIO_RENDERING_INFORMATION.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.Properties.NetworkAssociation
member.summary: This class defines all Commands-Parameters and Options associated with: . This category is for properties common to all network association objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.PropertySystem.Properties.Client
member.summary: This class defines all Commands-Parameters and Options associated with: .

summary.para: Description: Specifies the name the client uses to identify itself.
Description: Specifies the major version of the client.
Description: Specifies the major version of the client.
Description: Specifies the revision (or build number) of the client.
Description: Specifies the Windows Media DRM application private key of the client.
Description: Specifies the Windows Media DRM application certificate of the client.

Description: Specifies the Security Quality of Service for the connection to the driver. This relates to the Security Quality of Service flags for CreateFile. For example-these allow or disallow a driver to impersonate the client.
Description: Specifies the desired access the client is requesting to this driver. The possible values are the same as for CreateFile (e.g. GENERIC_READ-GENERIC_WRITE etc.).
Description: Specifies the share mode the client is requesting to this driver. The possible values are the same as for CreateFile (e.g. FILE_SHARE_READ-FILE_SHARE_WRITE etc.).
Description: Client supplied cookie returned by the driver in events posted as a direct result of operations issued by this client.
Description: Specifies the minimum buffer size (in bytes) used for sending commands to the driver.
Description: An advanced option for clients that wish to manually call or for each object on device disconnect-instead of relying on the API to call Close on its behalf.
